#note_source_type: explanation of what source_type is goes here
#note_experiment_id: QUOCA valid experiment_ids are found in QUOCA_CV.json
experiment: Climate run with zonal-mean tropical stratosphere nudged to reanalysis
#note_run_variant: Text stored in attribute variant_info (recommended, not required description of run variant)
#note_source_id: source_id (model name) must be registered at https://github.com/WCRP-CMIP/QUOCA_CVs/issues/new
grid: data regridded to a QUOCA standard 1x1 degree lonxlat grid from the native grid using an area-average preserving method.
license: QUOCA model data produced by E3SM is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike 4.0 International License .https://creativecommons.org/licenses). Consult https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/QUOCA/TermsOfUse for terms of use governing QUOCA output, including citation requirements and proper acknowledgment. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.
#output: Root directory for output (can be either a relative or full path)
#note_optional: **** The following descriptors are optional and may be set to an empty string
history: Output from v3.ccmi.PD_INT_custom30. resolution=ne30pg2_EC30to60E2r2.  compset = F2000
comment: This is the default metadata file, any data  should only be used for testing purposes
references: Shaocheng X., Christopher R. T., Hailong W., et al. The Energy Exascale Earth System Model Version 3. Part I: Overview of the Atmospheric Component. ESS Open Archive . April 13, 2025. DOI: 10.22541/essoar.174456922.21825772/v1
#note_CV: **** The following will be obtained from the CV and do not need to be defined here
#note_QUOCA: **** The following are set correctly for QUOCA and should not normally need editing
_history_template: %s ;rewrote data to be consistent with <activity_id> for variable <variable_id> found in table <table_id>.
#output_path_template: Template for output path directory using tables keys or global attributes, these should follow the relevant data reference syntax
